intro: Armeriastrum lepturodes, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate harsh coastal conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
